trans-unit.source: Serves as the primary control in the Web Parts control set for hosting <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.EditorPart"></xref> controls on a Web page.
Within the Web Parts control set, a zone is a composite control that covers a defined region on a Web page and contains server controls.
The primary functions of a zone are to lay out the controls it contains, and to provide a common user interface (UI) for those controls.

For general information about zones and how they are used in Web Parts applications, see the reference documentation for the base <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebZone> class, and [Web Parts Control Set Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The EditorZone control is one of the fundamental controls in the Web Parts control set.
A key feature of Web Parts is the ability of end users to modify (or personalize) Web pages according to their preferences, and save their personalized settings for future browser sessions.

One aspect of modifying Web Parts pages includes editing; users can edit the appearance, layout, behavior, and other properties of the visible <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> controls.
Several controls in the Web Parts control set provide the editing features, including the EditorZone control.

An EditorZone control becomes visible when a Web Parts page enters edit mode, and it makes available various <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.EditorPart> controls that can be used to personalize <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> controls.

The EditorZone control is very similar to its parent, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.EditorZoneBase> class, with one key difference: The EditorZone control provides a zone template, referenced in its <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.EditorZone.ZoneTemplate%2A> property.
The zone template adds the ability to declare content in the page persistence format.

Page developers can place an EditorZone control in the declarative markup of a Web page, add a child `<zonetemplate>` element, and within the `<zonetemplate>` element, add declarative references to <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.EditorPart> controls.

The EditorZone control also has a method, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.EditorZone.CreateEditorParts%2A>, which overrides a base method in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.EditorZoneBase> class.

This method is necessary so that an EditorZone control can create the zone template to contain any <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.EditorPart> controls that are added to the zone declaratively.
> [!NOTE] > The buttons in the EditorZone UI require client-side scripting in order to work correctly.
If scripting is disabled in the browser, the user will not be able to perform actions through the EditorZone UI.
Accessibility The markup rendered by default for this control might not conform to accessibility standards such as the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 1.0 (WCAG) priority 1 guidelines.
For details about accessibility support for this control, see [ASP.NET Controls and Accessibility](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.EditorZone"></xref> class.
Creates all the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.EditorPart"></xref> controls declared within a zone template in page persistence format.
The CreateEditorParts method overrides the base method to create only the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.EditorPart> controls that are declared within the zone template.
Any other <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.EditorPart> controls added to the zone must be added programmatically.
This can be done, for example, by implementing the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.IWebEditable> interface in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> control.

Then, in the overridden <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.IWebEditable.CreateEditorParts%2A> method, you can add a collection of custom <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.EditorPart> controls to a zone.

An <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.EditorPartCollection"></xref> that contains references to all the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.EditorPart"></xref> controls declared within the zone template.
The current <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.EditorPart"></xref> control does not have an ID.
Provides a template to contain child controls within an <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.EditorZone"></xref> control in page persistence format.
The ZoneTemplate property is the key difference between the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.EditorZone> class and the base <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.EditorZoneBase> class.

By adding support for a zone template, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.EditorZone> class enables page developers to place child <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.EditorPart> controls within an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.EditorZone> control in the declarative markup of a Web page.
The zone template acts as a container for the child controls.

> [!NOTE] > The set accessor for the ZoneTemplate property calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.EditorZoneBase.InvalidateEditorParts%2A> method, which forces the collection of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.EditorPart> controls declared in the template to be recreated.
This causes any changes in the contents of the template to be recognized.

To use a zone template declaratively within an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.EditorZone> control, you add a pair of `<zonetemplate>` tags, and reference <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.EditorPart> controls between the tags.

Only one zone template is rendered per instance of an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.EditorZone> control (therefore, there is no reason to add multiple `<zonetemplate>` elements to an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.EditorZone> control).

Also, the zone template of an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.EditorZone> control can contain only part controls that derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.EditorPart> class.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.ITemplate"></xref> zone template that acts as a container for child controls in the zone.
